required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Contralateral Head Rotation on Internal Jugular Vein to Carotid Artery Distance and Overlap Ratio
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Contralateral Head Rotation on Internal Jugular Vein to Carotid Artery Distance and Overlap Ratio

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to find out the effect of contra lateral head rotation to distance and overlapping of internal jugular vein and carotid artery at cricoid cartilage level by ultrasound guidance on the Malay race in Indonesia

detailed_description.textblock: Approval from Ethical Committee of Faculty of Medicine Universitas Indonesia was acquired prior conducting the study. 34 subjects were enrolled by using consecutive sampling method. Sample size was calculated by using numeric analytic comparative paired formula with repeated measurement. Inclusion criteria were patients with ASA score 1 and 2, aged between 18-60 years old, no anatomical abnormality in neck. Exclusion criteria were patients who were either obese, has history of previous central venous catheter cannulation, and limitation on contralateral head movement. Drop out criteria was abnormalities of anatomical IJV and CA. Basic demographic data, such as sex, age, body weight and height, body mass index were recorded. Patients were positioned in Trendelenburg (15°) position. Identification triangle of Sedillot at cricoid level in right neck with palpation at angle 0°. USG probe was placed upright at the top of triangle of Sedillot at cricoid level. Identification of IJV and CA was shown in transversal view then the IJV to CA distance and overlap ratio was calculated. Contralateral head rotation was done with protractor at angle 30°, 45°, and 60°. The distance and overlap ratio of IJV and CA was calculated in each angle.

primary_outcome.measure: IJV to CA distance at different contralateral rotation angle
primary_outcome.description: IJV to CA distance at different contralateral rotation angle (0°, 30°, 45°, 60°)

primary_outcome.measure: IJV to CA overlap ratio at different contralateral rotation angle
primary_outcome.description: IJV to CA overlap ratio at different contralateral rotation angle (0°, 30°, 45°, 60°)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Triangle of Sedillot identification using ultrasonography
arm_group.description: USG probe placed upright at the top of triangle of Sedillot at cricoid level

intervention.intervention_name: Triangle of Sedillot identification using ultrasonography
intervention.description: Contralateral head rotation was done with protractor at angle 30°, 45°, and 60°. The distance and overlap ratio of IJV and CA was calculated in each angle.
intervention.arm_group_label: Triangle of Sedillot identification using ultrasonography

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA score 1 and 2
- 18-60 years old
- no anatomical abnormality in neck
Exclusion Criteria:
- obese
- has history of previous central venous catheter cannulation
- limitation on contralateral head movement
